title: Vietnamese-style Beef & Noodle Broth
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Vietnamese-style Beef & Noodle Broth a try. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.67 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 21g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 278 calories. 173 people have made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 50 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. If you have beef flank steak, water, basil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 84%, this dish is outstanding. Try Vietnamese Style Beef And Noodle Broth Recipe, Vietnamese-Style Beef Noodle Soup, and Vietnamese Beef-Noodle Soup With Asian Greens, Okay Vietnamese/japanese for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
